forumNotes.content:
I have lately spent alot of time on trying to get my 1GB Flash bootable with a WinXP style bootmenu.  

I have learnt a couple of things.  

1.) Yes it is possible on both USB Flash and USB HDD  
2.) Fat16, Fat32 and NTFS works (DOS is not supported by NTFS)  
3.) You must have A DEVICE (CDROM or HDD) connected to the SATA or IDE port of your PC  
(Nothing is loaded from here but without it you get a BSOD error - inaccessible boot device)  
4.) Once created the bootdisk cannot simply be cloned to another (Nice unintended copy protection feature).  

I would like to compare notes with anybody who has done something similar.

Most people seem to opt for grub4dos when selecting a bootloader for USB Flash\\HDD. I wanted to keep it plain and stick to what we have, so I used the NT-style boot menu on my USB Flash device. It is currently bootable into a Dos boot menu (Win98 command prompt with Config.sys -Autoexec.bat menu system) and two versions of the same WinPE build (One with the normal set of Disk controler devices and one with an extended set including some SCSI and RAID controlers). While doing this i noticed the issues stated in post #1. i just wanted to know if anyone else attempted the same and if they noted the same issues. :smile:

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> While doing this i noticed the issues stated in post #1. i just wanted to know if anyone else attempted the same and if they noted the same issues. Only #3 is a an "issue" as I see it. Items #1 and #2 are OK. Item #4 is - pardon me the adjective ![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif) - obvious, NTLDR chainloads a bootsector that has some data that is SPECIFIC to the particular partition from which it derived. Not really a copy protection intended feature, simply the easiest way to multiboot that the (lazy) guys at Microsoft came up with. That is the main use of bootpart (almost since since the same 15 years): [http://www.winimage.com/bootpart.htm](http://www.winimage.com/bootpart.htm "External link") It is possible, using the same tools/approach I used to write MakeBS.cmd and MBRBATCH/MKIMG, replicate the behaviour of bootpart even if booted from another drive, it can even be done with ***bad*** ol' DEBUG: [http://www.msfn.org/...tem-t87269.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/Install-MS-DOS-710-onto-XP-Based-System-t87269.html "External link") [http://www.msfn.org/...DOS-t53599.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/Newbie-how-create-the-real-DOS-t53599.html "External link") If there is interest in the matter, I could - time permitting - write it, basic instructions/byte locations can be found on the Winimage forum: [http://forum.winimag...topic.php?t=276](http://forum.winimage.com/viewtopic.php?t=276 "External link") Issue #3 ***IS*** tricky, maybe, just ***maybe*** , it could be worked around using the "signature()" syntax in boot.ini, cannot say if it is possible to make it work with USB devices. Some notes are here: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=3593](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=3593 "External link") Are you willing to test this approach? :wink: Also, though maybe OT, another "mystery" remains the "/rollback" parameter: [http://www.boot-land...topic=2362\&st=7](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=2362&st=7 "External link") :wink:
jaclaz
